Node.definition: primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= man (called Ben Oni (בֶּן־אֹונִי) by his mother), tribe, and territory; ◄ twelfth and last son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and second son of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference

= man; ► son of Shealtiel (שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵל) or, according to of Pedaiah (פְּדָיָה) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► governor of Judea (יְהוּדָה) after the exile; according to , father of Meshullam (מְשֻׁלָּם) Hananiah (חֲנַנְיָה) and Shelomith (שְׁלֹמִית)
literally: head; hence: = the person in leadership of a group of people, or, by extension, the most important object among a set of objects
= a group of people to which one traces one's ancestry

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= man; ◄ son of Sennacherib (סַנְחֵרִיב) ► king of Assyria (אַשּׁוּר)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives

Node.gloss: to cause (someone or some activity) to stop
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans no longer to be engaged in an action that they were engaged in previously
= a male human
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= state in which humans are aware of the importance of a situation

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= process by which an event increases in intensity
literally: injury; hence: = material or immaterial damage to one's asset's or affaires
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= referent pointing to a point in time, usually in reference to another event
= written specimen of a document, used only for royal decrees
= man, better known as Artaxerxes I; ◄ son of Ahasuerus (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) (Xerxes I); ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) time of Ezra (עֶזְרָא) and Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה)

= action by which humans speak written words aloud
= man; ► governor; after exile

= a high ranking official, usually learned, who served in the king's court and was responsible for the king's official business ► held some authority in administrative and financial, and perhaps also military matters
= fellow member of the same group of people, sharing a bond of employment or a common purpose
= to leave a certain place
= process by which humans act without any unnecessary delay
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= state in which someone is no longer engaged in an action one used to be engaged in previously

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
